Dear Parents/Guardians,

We want to give you a current update on the Corno-virus and the status of the school. Currently,
there are no plans to close the school. We are in close contact with the Utah Health Department who will keep the school updated and advised. The Utah Health Department will advise the school if the decision to close the school becomes imminent.

We are taking the necessary preparation steps if school closure becomes necessary. The steps will include continuing education at home through different technology means. We will send out more detailed information on the Emergency Digital Education plan if school closure is determined.
We appreciate your understanding, and we will continue to keep you and the students updated and informed on the issue.

Thank you,

Ms. Vickie Peterson, M.Ed
Vice Principal

The Easter Egg Roll is a timeless tradition that dates back to 1878 where children 13 and younger and their parents participate on the south lawn of the White House. First Lady Melania Trump is the host which includes egg rolling, story telling, picture taking, entertainment, and other fun activities. There will be a State Egg display featuring designs from each state across the nation and our egg will be on display representing Utah. What a compliment for our school!

Congratulations to our Beehive Academy community.

Have you ever considered hosting an exchange student?

Every year Beehive Academy families are given the great opportunity to host students from other countries. This is an excellent way to get to know other cultures and to add a wonderful new person into your life! These students are friendly, well behaved, and eager to learn. Each student comes with a local coordinator for their - and YOUR - support. All arrive with their own spending money and insurance. The responsibilities of host families are to provide a bed, meals, and transportation to and from school. Remember that you do not need to change your lifestyle in order to host an exchange student--far from it! The point of this program is to include this new person into your existing lifestyle.

Melissa (Lisa) Allen has first hand knowledge of hosting students and would love to tell you her experiences. Talking to her does not commit you to hosting but will give you more information about the program. Please e-mail her with your questions:

Melissa.Allen@beehiveacademy.org

Thanks so much. Our school LOVES exchange students!

TEAM INCLUDING BEEHIVE SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY ACADEMY STUDENTS ADVANCES TO FIRST LEGO LEAGUE WORLD FESTIVAL IN HOSTON

Sandy, Utah—A team that included three Beehive Science and Technology students has advanced to the FIRST (an acronym for For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology) LEGO League World Festival Competition to be held in Houston April 17 through 20.

In order to participate in the World Festival Competition, the Bionic Porcupines team had to move through a series of local competitions that culminated at the Utah First Lego League at Southern Utah University on Feb. 16. The Bionic Porcupines won the Champion’s Award and first place in the robot game during the event. This will be the second year in a row that the Bionic Porcupines have gone to the World Festival Competition.

Bionic Porcupines team members from Beehive are Allison Drennan, Kassie Holt and Timothy Holt. Also on the team are Mount Jordan’s Adria Brooks and Midvale Middle School’s Eric Snaufer and Andrew Wan. This team is coached by Annie Drennan, Mark Snaufer and Ben Holt.

Parents, do you know anyone with a flexible schedule who'd like to make a little money substituting the wonderful kids at Beehive Academy? We actually pay more than the School districts pay their substitutes plus we have smaller class sizes and the best students anywhere!

Sometimes we are able to plan ahead but other times substitutes are needed last minute. Of course, if we ask and a substitute is not available, no problem, we ask another person. Even if you have certain days you are available and certain days you are not, we'd like to hear from you.

We are looking for patient adults who are 21 years old or older, who get along well with teens. Pay is $15 per hour and we pay for the security check. With all students having an i-Pad, it is easy to teach the scheduled lesson that day--you don't need a teaching degree! Ms. Barnes would like to set up training for new substitutes so we'd like to hear from those interested right away.

Please contact Lisa for more information: lisa.stearns@beehiveacademy.org.

Thanks!

Is your student outgrowing their uniform way too fast? We would like to introduce Beehive Academy uniform swap. Bring your washed, in good condition (no holes, not faded) uniforms and we will swap them for same amount, free of charge. We will have this service year round as long as we have uniforms: Example:

We have a large selection of polo shirts, pants, shorts, skirts, and a few hoodies--there's a good chance we have your student's size.

First come, first serve starting tonight at our Back to School night (I'll be here at 5:30 pm so come early).

Thanks in advance to those who can help!
